Michigan Initial Health & Safety Training Module B
Section 1: Child Development

Cautions When Monitoring For Developmental Milestones

It is important to consider a few cautions when monitoring children for accomplishment of developmental milestones. It is beneficial to keep an eye out for healthy development.

Physical development is easier to identify; however, the other forms of development are equally important. Delays in any area of development may signify a concern. For example, the inability to express emotions appropriately is linked to behavioral difficulties.

Always be cautious when measuring a child against a checklist. These are averages of when a child does something, not the exact age by which they must do it.

Observe that a skill develops close to a recommended age range.

Development is uneven and varies from child to child. One child may be slightly ahead of the curve on one set of skills, and slightly behind on another.
